item.title: Coronavirus: Moral duty to get all children back in school - PM
item.description: Boris Johnson wants schools in England to be the last sector to close in any future local lockdowns.

item.title: Coronavirus: Redundancies rise fivefold as pandemic hits jobs
item.description: A Freedom of Information request shows a rapid rise in firms in June saying they were cutting staff.

item.title: Beirut explosion: World leaders to hold aid summit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron has organised Sunday's online talks to generate aid for Lebanon.

item.title: Spain's ex-King Juan Carlos lands in Abu Dhabi: reports
item.description: A photograph appears to show Spain's former monarch landing in Abu Dhabi after leaving his country.

item.title: Footage from a church mid-explosion brings hope to Beirutis
item.description: This Greek Orthodox church's altar survived the blast unscathed - even its oil lamp stayed lit.

item.title: Eleven die in fire in Czech Republic tower block
item.description: Six died in the building, and another five were killed after jumping from the 11th floor.

item.title: Oxford Street stabbing: Three arrested after teen killed
item.description: The male died after he was stabbed on Market Place at the junction with Oxford Street.

item.title: Belarus election: President Lukashenko faces toughest test in years
item.description: President Lukashenko is seeking a sixth term in office as Belarus votes after a series of protests.

item.title: Tate boss defends plan to cut 200 jobs in art gallery shops and cafes
item.description: "Sadly at the moment the trading business is too big," Maria Balshaw told Desert Island Discs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Masks made mandatory in parts of Paris as infections rise
item.description: People will be required to wear face masks outdoors in busy areas of the French capital from Monday.

item.title: Home Office seeks military help over migrant crossings
item.description: More than 500 people have been intercepted crossing the English Channel in recent days.

item.title: Sideman quits Radio 1Xtra over BBC's use of racial slur
item.description: The BBC 1Xtra DJ says the broadcast of the word was a "slap in the face of our community".

item.title: The Papers: Reopening of schools a 'national priority'
item.description: Boris Johnson's plan to ensure schools reopen in England fully in September is among Sunday's front page stories.

item.title: Coronavirus: Winchester teenager films lockdown documentary
item.description: Teenager Octavia Sanger is releasing her first documentary on an international streaming service.

item.title: Hiroshima and Nagasaki: 75th anniversary of atomic bombings
item.description: It is 75 years since the US dropped atomic bombs on the two Japanese cities, leading to WW2's end.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'open spaces'
item.description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "open spaces".

item.title: Black Lives Matter: Campaign for black businesses has been 'extraordinary'
item.description: A campaign to support businesses run by black people has had an "extraordinary effect" on sales.

item.title: Why the French are 'European champions' at abandoning pets
item.description: Tens of thousands of pets are abandoned every summer in France. What's behind this sad phenomenon?

item.title: Coronavirus: Fact-checking fake stories in Africa
item.description: We've taken a look into some of the most widely-shared false stories about the pandemic across Africa.

item.title: Coronavirus: Parents 'petrifying' choice on lockdown heart op
item.description: Brayden Bull's parents were caught between the risks of both Covid-19 or an operation in lockdown.

item.title: US election 2020: What is the electoral college?
item.description: How does the US electoral college elect the president?

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: How fishing trade transformed to survive lockdown
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic is forcing the fishing industry to diversify to stay in business.

item.title: Coronavirus: India is turning to faster tests to meet targets
item.description: With coronavirus cases rising sharply, India has turned to rapid testing kits. But how reliable are they?

item.title: 2019 heroics gave England belief anything is possible during latest thrilling win - Root
item.description: Captain Joe Root says England's habit of pulling off unlikely victories gives them the belief they can win matches from almost any situation.

item.title: Lewandowski stars as Bayern crush Chelsea to set up Barca quarter-final
item.description: Bayern Munich will meet Barcelona in the Champions League quarter-finals as Chelsea suffer a crushing 7-1 aggregate defeat.

item.title: Former world No 1 Johnson leads going into US PGA Championship final round
item.description: Former world number one Dustin Johnson charges into the lead on a thrilling third day at the 2020 US PGA Championship in San Francisco.

item.title: 70th Anniversary Grand Prix: Losing is something Lewis Hamilton cannot accept
item.description: There could be a battle on Sunday when Lewis Hamilton starts behind Valtteri Bottas - but it's Nico Hulkenberg who could warm fans' hearts.

item.title: Woakes and Buttler steer England to stunning victory over Pakistan - report & highlights
item.description: England snatch a riveting three-wicket victory over Pakistan in the first Test at Emirates Old Trafford thanks to Chris Woakes and Jos Buttler.

item.title: McGill unhappy with opponent Clarke as tempers flare in Sheffield
item.description: Qualifiers Jamie Clarke and Anthony McGill are involved in a feisty exchange at the World Championship in which the referee has to step in to diffuse the situation.

item.title: Highlights: England pull off incredible win against Pakistan
item.description: England snatch a riveting three-wicket victory over Pakistan in the first Test at Emirates Old Trafford thanks to a daring partnership between Chris Woakes and Jos Buttler.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of opening schools?
item.description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New rules mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What happens when the furlough scheme ends?
item.description: Almost 10 million people have accessed the scheme, which closes in October.

item.title: Coronavirus immunity: Can you catch it twice?
item.description: Immunity is the crucial question and understanding it will tell us how the pandemic will end.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus curbs country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus: What am I allowed to do in the hot weather this weekend?
item.description: Hot weather is expected across the UK this weekend, but how do you stay within the rules?

item.title: Coronavirus: Where can I now go on holiday in the UK?
item.description: Where can I go and what can do on a holiday in the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a recession?
item.description: The world faces the worst recession for 80 years. But what does that mean?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Preston and other areas?
item.description: Preston has become the latest place to impose restrictions. But how does a local lockdown work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: Belgium, Bahamas and Andorra are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules are changing in England - but what can you now do?

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I get travel insurance and what are my travel rights?
item.description: As quarantine rules are relaxed, holidays are back on the agenda

item.title: Coronavirus: How to stay cool in a face mask as hot UK weather forecast
item.description: Temperatures are forecast to top 30C in some parts of the UK this weekend. Perhaps it is not the time you want to be partially covering your face.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will schools reopen fully?
item.description: Schools are set to go back for the autumn term, but scientists say society may have to make trade-offs.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: The rise, fall, and rise of the status pineapple
item.description: For a couple of centuries, the British were in an unlikely frenzy for the exotic fruit.

item.title: First time buyers: The end of the bank of mum and dad?
item.description: Nationwide has taken away the option for parents to help first-time buyers with small deposits.

item.title: My Money: 'I eat biscuits like a naughty schoolboy'
item.description: Mark Bauwens from France takes us through his week during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Lebanon: Why the country is in crisis
item.description: What has caused such anger across Lebanon - and why it is not going away.

item.title: ‘Why I run with a car tyre on my back’
item.description: Ben runs in the Peak District to boost his mental health after a suicide attempt two years ago.
